intro: Alysicarpus glumaceus var. minor, commonly known as small-headed burr grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant produces small, hairy pods that contain seeds with a hard, burred surface. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in grasslands and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential agricultural use.
